revised_title: Chemical Processes in Shocked Interstellar Gas: A Review
tldr: This article presents a review of molecular formation and destruction processes in shocked interstellar gas. It discusses various physical and chemical processes that occur in shocked gases, including collision-induced dissociation, electron dissociation, and chemical reactions. The article also explores the chemistry of specific regions of the interstellar medium and the importance of molecular observations as a diagnostic probe of shock environments.
